product_name: MuradVitamin C Dark Circle Correcting Eye Serum
summary: SummaryHighlightsCruelty FreeMurad Vita-C Eyes Dark Circle Corrector is a gold-stabilized vitamin C eye serum that brightens and fights the look of dark circles in as little as 2 weeks.
details: DetailsBenefitsFormulated to target multiple types of dark circlesBlue/purple: Low microcirculation & thin skin around eyes the increases visibility of unoxygenated bloodBrown: Sun damage, irritation & genetics can result in hyperpigmentationRed: Triggered by inflammation, irritation & allergiesAlways tested on people, never on animalsFormulated WithoutParabens, sulfates, and phthalatesResearch ResultsAfter 2 weeks, 86% saw brighter eye area skinAfter 6 weeks, 85% saw a reduction in dark circlesItem 2562510How To UseAM and PMCleanse with Essential-C Cleanser. Pat dry.Gently pat Vita-C Dark Circle Correcting Eye Serum around the eye area. Warning: Avoid contact with eyes.Massage Vita-C Glycolic Brightening Serum over face, neck and chest and follow with a moisturizer. Use a Murad sunscreen during the day. Store in upright position.Precautions: Avoid contact with eyes.IngredientsWater/Aqua/Eau, Glycerin, Dimethicone, Hydroxyethyl Acrylate/Sodium Acryloyldimethyl Taurate Copolymer, Titanium Dioxide (CI 77891), Niacinamide, Ascorbic Acid, Urea, Yeast Amino Acids, Trehalose, Inositol, Taurine, Betaine, Glutathione, Tetrahexyldecyl Ascorbate, Glucosyl Hesperidin, Fucus Vesiculusus Extract, Xymenynic Acid, HDI/Trimethylol Hexyllactone Crosspolymer, Mica, Triheptanoin, Propylene Glycol Dicaprate, Sorbitol, Helianthus Annuus (Sunflower) Seed Extract, C13-16 Isoparaffin, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Polyisobutene, Silica, Tin Oxide, Hexylene Glycol, PEG-7 Trimethylolpropane Coconut Ether, Acetyl Zingerone, Asparagospsis Armata Extract, Chlorella Vulgaris Extract, Terminalia Ferdinandiana Fruit Extract, Hordeum Vulgare (Barley) Extract, Ascophyllum Nodosum Extract, Sodium Hyaluronate, Xanthan Gum, Cucumis Sativus (Cucumber) Extract, Trimethylsiloxysilicate, PEG-8 Methyl Ether Triethoxysilane, Gold, Caprylyl Glycol, Phenoxyethanol, Ethylhexylglycerin, Iron Oxides (CI 77492), Iron Oxides (CI 77491).Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: AM and PMCleanse with Essential-C Cleanser. Pat dry.Gently pat Vita-C Dark Circle Correcting Eye Serum around the eye area. Warning: Avoid contact with eyes.Massage Vita-C Glycolic Brightening Serum over face, neck and chest and follow with a moisturizer. Use a Murad sunscreen during the day. Store in upright position.Precautions: Avoid contact with eyes.

reviews.headline: Wonderful results
reviews.comments: This product is fantastic.  The dark under eye circles are beginning to lighten. I will definitely be buying this again

reviews.headline: I COULDNT TELL IF IT WORKED
reviews.comments: I am a black woman with dark circles under my eyes and I couldnt tell after about a year of using this if it worked or not. I think it should be clear that the darkness and aging under the eyes is going away after that long. there were also problems with the pump. i ordered this about 3 different times over the course of that time from a different makeup store and from here if im not mistaken and sometimes the bottle would come empty and nothin gwould come out of a brand new container. there was no way to tell when the bottle was getting low and until you were just out so you couldnt tell when it was time to buy a new bottle to have one on the way. the design was a bit weird to be able to tell how much product you had left. i liked how it felt and looked with the gold glimmer but the dark circles are darker than my skin and not a good look. i dont have time to play around wiht these creams that arent going to work for real people

reviews.headline: This Works Great!
reviews.comments: I've used this for a couple of years and it seems to camouflage my dark circles under my eyes. I put it on before my foundation. You only need a tiny bit.

reviews.headline: Amazing
reviews.comments: My whole life i have had dark circles underneath my eye. This product helped resolve that problem. I make sure to put it on eveey moring snd occisonally feel confident enough to go out the house with out having to put on any type of concealer or make up

reviews.headline: Dose not work
reviews.comments: Used the product for a month with no results. Waste of money

reviews.headline: Dose not work
reviews.comments: Used the product for a month with no results. Waste of money

reviews.headline: Burned
reviews.comments: I wanted this to work, but when I used it around my eyes it burned..

reviews.headline: works great, smells terrible
reviews.comments: This product really works to correct those dark under-eyes. if it didn't smells so bad, I'd give it 5 stars

reviews.headline: stinks
reviews.comments: I had high hopes because of the reviews but I hate using this. the smell is strong and reminds me of barbecue sauce!

reviews.headline: Yes I would buy again
reviews.comments: Wish it came in travel size only because of initial costs.I purchased the full size previously. But all used up! lol 71yrs old.My younger sister told me I looked so pretty one day.And all I had done different was put on Murad environmental Vita-C eyes dark circle corrector.Then I started seeing results after a couple weeks.

reviews.headline: Highly recommend!!
reviews.comments: I am only 26 years of age and its working drastically and at a fast pace!I know it's supposed to be a two weeks change but its helping within just days for me. I like to use these serums while im young so i dont have these issues when im older. I definitely recommend in buying this product! 5/5 stars!

reviews.headline: Good product
reviews.comments: I have been using this for a number of months. It is mild and feels good going on. I keep using it because when I switched to a retinol based product, thinking it might be better, the retinol based product seemed to within a very short time, CREATE wrinkles, so I immediately switched back to this Vitamin C product which is richer and not harsh.

reviews.headline: didn't work
reviews.comments: I used the entire product and I didn't see any changes in my dark circles. For the price, I won't buy again.

reviews.headline: Dark circle cream
reviews.comments: I have bought lots of products to help reduce my dark circles but this product is the best. It really works!!! Will definitely buy again if needed

reviews.headline: Amazing!
reviews.comments:
I like to try different products and this is by far my favorite! I get dark circles from allergies or being on my computer to much. This gives me immediate results 
Ive never gone wrong with Murad product s

reviews.headline: Works amazingly but flakes
reviews.comments: This stuff is amazing. I gave horrid dark circles and bags. I do get under eye fillers but that does nothing for the darkness. This stuff is a god send. However, it does get white and flakey so i just dont use it in the morning. I wear it over night and wash and tone my face in the morning. Its worth every penny

reviews.headline: Not sure yet just started it a couple of days ago.
reviews.comments: Love Murad products.

reviews.headline: Does not work with my emu oil, smells like bacon
reviews.comments:
Works well, I have noticed a difference in the shade of purple under my eyes- they have lightened even within the first week of me using it.

However, mine smells like bacon which is really odd to me. I also notice if I apply emu oil specifically (have not tried other oils so far), the serum lifts and rolls into little pills and I have to brush them off my face. It does not do this under my eye cream/moisturizer, just the days I layer with emu oil. I think in the future I would use this maybe during the more humid months, and find something that doesn't come off with the oil for dryer seasons where I need the extra moisture.

reviews.headline: Eye Serum
reviews.comments: Goes on smooth and feel nice.

reviews.headline: Only docking one star because of price
reviews.comments:
I ran out of this product about a month ago. I think it actually did help with my darker under eye circles a bit (mine aren't related to hyperpigmentation, rather, just being fair complected). I also have eczema and thought this product was moisturizing around the eyes. I recently purchased The Ordinary caffeine serum for my eyes, but that product does nothing for me unlike what the Murad serum has done for me. If anything, it dries my eyes out. 

The only problem with this product is the price. However, it lasted me about 6 months when I used it every day. Not bad

faceoff_positive.comments:
First impressions Murad BzzzKit!!

Rapid Age Spot and Pigment Lightening Serum, Vitamin-C Glycolic Brightening Serum and Vitamin-C Dark Circle Corrector

Shipment recvd on April 10, 2020!!!!
They were very informative of when I was going to get my products in the mail, date it was shipped, etc. I was very excited to actually receive it in the mail, to be honest I thought it was quite too good to be true but here it is in it's glory, and per the rules of this trial I should:
-receive awesome Murad products in the mail 
-test them out for two weeks
-give an honest, DETAILED review with awesome pictures and my opinion on whether I think these rock or not. 

Alright beauties just so your aware...

Prior experience with Murad- none really but have heard great things until just recently I received a youth renewal serum and eye cream sample in one of my beauty subscription boxes (I think) and I was using those every other night (the youth renewal serum) and every night (the eye cream) I had only been using them for about a week or two and im sure I missed a couple days. 

**Disclaimer** I replaced these products with any other facial serum I would have used (including the 2 murad products I was trying). I typically only use a cleanser, makeup remover, occasional light exfoliator cleanser, and moisturizer daily-ish and continued with that routine but used these 3 serums (Rapid Age Spot and Pigment Lightening Serum, Vitamin-C Glycolic Brightening Serum and Vitamin-C Dark Circle Corrector) everyday over a 2 week period. I also continued my make up application normally but I did use these every day and night.. I took pictures throughout to show the progress of before and after application, morning and evening
Note-I love the Aveeno brightening facial cleanser for a mild face wash, this is what I use. I do feel like I have sensitive skin and this does not break out your face. 

And now to the good stuff!! 

Night one. Revealing my products!!!
And application...

Let's start with naming the products. It looks like they all come from the Murad "Environmental Shield" line and are all part of step 2 the "treat". I believe that step one is the cleanser. I got the Vitamin-C Glycolic Brightening Serum (which is said to be used daily am and pm FIRST) applying over face and neck. The Rapid Age Spot and Pigment Lightening Serum was included also and it says to apply this after the brightening serum as an extra "boost" at NIGHT all over face as well. Lastly I received the Vitamin-C Dark Circle Corrector which I will apply am and pm patting gently under the eye area. 

Application day one
(Evening application after shower and cleansing face)
#1 The brightening serum has made my skin feel very soft and dewy. It was a thick liquid that was yellow in color and had a shimmery tint throughout that was very pretty. Upon application however it was very painful to the existing acne patches on my skin. I'm not sure I would apply to these areas again until maybe healed a bit better. It stung very bad on those areas, but left my skin looking need I say brighter? You all can be the judge. My skin is very soft however after application but left a little sticky. Absorbed well and didn't flake off...yet 
Onto the rapid age spot lightening serum. 

#2The lightening serum is a clear liquid. It applied like a gel consistency. Dried quickly and went on smoothly and easily. It was not burning to the skin and left it feeling like a smooth buttery texture but sticky. Very sticky. (May be a great primer!) Will tell in the morning. 
And lastly but not least, I feel the most important! 

#3Under eye was a thicker lotion and same color as the brightening serum. It applied smoothly and easily patting under my eye. Appeared light the other creme with the shimmer, brightening sheen. It's light reflecting like the brightening creme. It did not hurt and blended very easily. 

Application 
day 2: morning
**Every morning prior to any facial application I do wash off my face with a mild cleansing water. 
I began my facial routine this am with only the three Murad products. I first applied about 4 pumps of the brightening serum directly to my face. (Too much) Rubbed it in gently and there was a mild irritation and stinging again. My Face felt smooth after application and I waited about 10 mins before applying the next serum. I went ahead and did the eye cream second. I only use about half a pump per eye and I gently pat and kindof push it into my under eye area melting it in until absorbed completely. It does create a warmth underneath your eye that intensifies if you rub it in so only pat. I like this creme. Lastly the gel like brightening serum. Dried quickly and left my skin feeling sticky, prefect for a primer. 
Day 2: evening 
Same old but through the day I wore no make up and I had to wipe my face off to remove the flaky lotion pieces that were on my face. Conclusion less is more. 
AppLied all three, a sparse amount. Patted under eye creme only until absorbed. Again leaves skin feeling sticky and I think it's the light serum, the gel one. This is my least favorite so far. 

Day 3: am
I tried a different approach this am and I think im liking this better. Again less is more. I started with a light layer, only 2 pumps of the brightening cream, concentrating on the cheek area and forehead. I then applied the under eye creme, about half a pump per eye and gently patted into eye and corner if eye near nose till absorbed. I only pat now. And then the gel light serum I pump 2 squirts into my hands and rub it in then gently pat onto my face until absorbed. I'm waiting before I apply anything else. I think this is going to make a huge difference. Overall however I think I mag avoid using the gel light serum bc it flakes off my skin, the other two seem to be working well the favorite being the under eye creme. 

Day 3 only applies eye cream today 

Day 4 am
Skin feels better so applied again all three 
Less is more!

Day 5-10 
Again messed up my face with fAce razors ahhh! Had to take a couple days rest of everything on my face. I did continue to use the eye creme however and I used the first brightening serum. A few times. 
I will say less is certainly more. You do not need a lot of this product. 
Day 11- 14
Am application
Applied all three serums. Used one good squirt of the bright serum, a 3/4 squirt of the eye creme to use on both eyes and about a squirt and a half of the light serum. 
With the light serum I now apply to my palm and rub it on all my fingers then pat it on my face lightly all over like the eye creme. I also before applying this gel like serum will use a cotton round to wipe around my eye area and get any excess eye creme removed. The eye creme needs to stay under the eye area only. If any gets rubbed lower down it will flake off. So pat the eye creme directly under the eye where your dark circles lay ONLY. If it goes anywhere else and mixes with anything else it will flake off. I think this works best. I am learning as I go, still unsure if it is helping. All of the creme's are less harsh and do not burn or tingle on my face now either. 

Final thoughts:
I see now I am requested to review each item individually so I will attach the above with my pictures to all and then attach my final thoughts on each item also. Thanks everyone for reading my extensive review. I hope it helps. 

*disclaimer I am not new to makeup but I am slightly fresher in the skincare so my techniques are my own and no one elses. I don't claim to be better or worse at anything and these are just my personal thoughts and review on these products and how they worked on MY skin. Everyone is different and beautiful and what may not work on some may work wonders on others. Always keep that in mind!!!! 

Final thoughts

Lightening serum - overall less is way more. I would suggest using it as a toner almost. Apply last and lightly pat onto skin until dry. It feels and resembles hair gel and is sticky as such. Less is more. Worked okay as a primer, I never wanted to use too much makeup over top these products because I figured it would ruin it. I never personally saw much of a difference but maybe my face isn't super dull? I dunno. 

Brightening Cream - this product is intended to go on first and again less is more. I applied about a good pump to my face, make sure you have no cuts or irritations already on your skin as it will burn. My face started off a little sensitive so this creme wAs a bit harsh at first but after a few days my face calmed down (unrelated to these products) and these serums no longer burned or tingled. Again I never really could tell a difference though. It did make me wear less makeup however and I wouldn't say I hated this. I will say if you apply more then it does tend to flake off so remember less is more. Overall I probably wont add these creme's and serums to my daily routine. I don't think it made a huge difference and I didn't like the flaking of the product. That did stop after I started using less. 

Eye creme- Now the eye creme was my favorite of all three and I continue to use this one on the daily. Do I see a difference? No. Maybe you all can notice one but I don't but for some reason I still use it. I must like it! It is a lighter orange color that seems like it would brighten the under eye and I think that's about it. I think it will give a brightening effect but it does not cover up any darkness. Dark circles are still there as you can see. I would be hesitant to use this under another product bc it did get flaky but only in places outside the orbital eye area. Overall I seemed to like this product but I don't think there is much of a difference 

I already stopped using the other two. I guess just personally this Murad trio was not my favorite but I have come to love Murad products such as the renewing eye creme and the retinol youth serum. Thanks beauties!
faceoff_positive.headline: This is my favorite of the line

faceoff_negative.comments: I received this dark circle corrector as a gift (as part of a Bzzkit, also received the Murad rapid dark spot correcting serum). I was really excited to try it out, and I put on the eye cream overnight the day it arrived. I used one pump for both eyes, as it spreads easily and a little bit goes a long way. The eye cream has golden shimmer which is very pretty. Initially it felt nice I normally don't use an eye cream and just use my face lotion on my eyes, so I was excited to try an eye cream, especially because I have both redness and dark circles around my eyes, and this product is supposed to help with both of those. However the next morning my eyes were super puffy, way more puffy than normal in the mornings, and were also kind of hot. I have very sensitive skin, particularly around the eyes, and obviously allergies are individual so just because I had an allergic reaction doesn't mean someone else would. I checked the ingredients to see if there was anything that was a known allergen for me one of the ingredients is "terminalia Ferdinandiana fruit extract" which apparently is a type of Australian plum. I have never eaten this particular variety of plum, however I am allergic to the normal plums you buy in American grocery stores, so I am assuming this is what caused my issue because none of the other ingredients seemed like anything that would be irritating. Thus, if you are not allergic to plums, this may totally work for you! However, I cannot evaluate its effectiveness because I was afraid to use it after the initial allergic reaction. I was really excited about the idea of a dark circle/ red circle corrector, so I guess I will see if another company makes a vitC Eye cream without any fruit extracts. One positive thing I will say about Murad: normally I assume that the various plant/fruit extracts in these types of products are just there for show but really are at too low of levels to actually do anything. However, if Murad put enough of this Australian plum extract in this cream to cause an allergic reaction, they must actually put substantial quantities of all of these plant extracts in their products! I really liked the other product I received (rapid dark spot correcting serum), and most people do not have weird allergies like plum allergies, so I think Murad is a good brand overall, just this particular product does not work for me because It gives me an allergic reaction. One other thing I will say is that the packaging is great! I accidentally dropped this on the tile floor in the bathroom and the outside part cracked, but not the inside where the actual product is. The jar is very thick with two layers but that lets the outside layer act as a "helmet" for the inside, which apparently I need, haha.
faceoff_negative.headline: Seem to be allergic to this eye cream
